meanings.sent1: She is very touchy and gets upset over small things.

meanings.sent3: It's best to avoid touchy topics like politics at family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The situation became touchy when they started discussing past mistakes.
meanings.sent5: Her touchy nature makes it challenging to have open conversations with her.

meanings.sent1: His sunburned skin is touchy to any touch.

meanings.sent3: The touchy cat recoiled when petted too firmly.
meanings.sent4: The touchy wound stung even with the lightest touch.
meanings.sent5: Her touchy feet couldn't bear the discomfort of tight shoes.

meanings.definition: Tending to cause tension or conflict
meanings.sent1: Bringing up that touchy subject always leads to arguments.
meanings.sent2: The touchy negotiations between the two countries were challenging.
meanings.sent3: Their touchy relationship often resulted in misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The touchy issue of budget cuts divided the team.
meanings.sent5: The touchy atmosphere in the room made everyone uneasy.
